Pre-Game Insights: India maintains a significant psychological advantage due to their experience in ICC championship finals and momentum in breaking milestones.
South Africa is a force to be reckoned with, showcasing their ability to turn the tide in close encounters.
Miscellaneous Highlights: A grand celebration of T20 cricket.
Rahul Dravid's farewell game as India coach.
A majestic Rohit Sharma-Virat Kohli special.
Bumrah and Arshdeep sweeping aside the Proteas threat.
Billions of Indian fans across the globe glued to their TV and streaming platforms to witness India lift the T20 World Cup trophy for the second time.
Others: India maintains the advantage with 14 wins in 26 matches against South Africa.
Head-to-Head statistics in T20Is show India with 14 wins, 11 losses, and 1 no result against South Africa.
India's Rohit Sharma leads the most runs with 420, while Bhuvneshwar Kumar leads the most wickets with 14 against South Africa.
South Africa's David Miller leads the most runs with 431, while Lungi Ngidi leads the most wickets with 10 against India.
